issues.description: The `Person` model in the template has its fields declared as private, but in the solution the same fields are declared public. This visibility mismatch can confuse students comparing the two artifacts and understanding the intended encapsulation of the data model.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the field visibility. For example, revert the solution modelâ€™s public fields back to private with getters/setters to match the template and maintain encapsulation.

issues.description: In the problem statement description for Part 2, the text mistakenly refers to `Consumer<List<Note>>` when describing PersonController methods, but the template and intended implementation use `Consumer<List<Person>>`. This parameter-type mismatch in the instructions may confuse students.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement text to reference `Consumer<List<Person>>` for the PersonController methods instead of `Consumer<List<Note>>`.
